بسم اللّه الرّحمن الرّحيم
كتبت إليك عن سلامة والحمد للّه وأنا أرجو أن
أدخل إلى يومين ولا تدع أن تشتري حوائج رمضان والحمد لــلّه
على سلامتك الّتي حاطتكم في عافية فلا يكون في قلوبكم
غم وأبو كريم يقريكم سلام كثيرا وأنا أوجّه لكم
من بيتنا إليكم ولا تدع أن الجارية في بدرقة
على الاجران فتنقلوا البر إلى المنزل وتصيروه في البيت
الدّاخل والملبّن الدّاخل حتّى يقام لكم عند الكندوج
الكعبي بسم اللّه الرّحمن الرّحيم أخوه مرتضى
حتّى نكتري لكم من يصلحه واقروا أختكم السّلام كثيرا
ونحن ندخل شا قريب اللّه شا اللّه وابعث الجارية إلى
الإسكاف حتّى تروح على الخف واحفظي السّلعة
مع ما معك اقبضوا منّي أفضل السّلام والمنّة ونسل ونسئل
يكن عندكم كثير السّلم
أبقاك اللّه وحفظك
وأمتع بك

[In the name of God, the Compassionate, the Merciful!]
I am writing being, thank God, in good health, and I hope to [I am writing to thee] in good health, praise be to God, and I hope that
be home within two days. Do not fail to buy the articles for Ramaḍân, and praise be to God come home by two days. Do not fail to buy the necessities of Ramaḍan and thank God
for thy safety which has kept thee in good health. Let there not be in your hearts for your safety which has kept you in good health. Let there not be in your hearts
grief. And Abû Karîm sends thee copious greetings. And I am sending grief. And Abu Karim sends you copious greeting. And I am sending ...
from our house to thee. And do not fail to [send?] the slave-girl with escort to from our house to you. And do not fail to send the slave-girl with escort to
the threshingfloors and to remove the wheat to the dwelling and put it in the inner the threshingfloors and to remove the wheat to the dwellinghouse and put it in the inner
chamber and the inner brickwork so that it may be well kept for you in the vessel holding chamber and the inner brickwork so that it may be well kept in the vessel which holds grain.
And cover it well and build a temporary wall round it grain. And cover it well and build a temporary wall round it
until we hire someone to put it right for you. And convey copious greetings to your sister. until we hire some one to put it right for you. And convey copious greeting to your sister
and we shall come home soon, please God. And send the slave-girl to And we shall come home soon, please God. And send the slave-girl to
the cobbler that she may go about on shoes. And take care of the goods
with what thou hast in possession. Take from me the best of greetings and thanks and we ask with what you have got. Take from me the best of greetings and thanks and we ask
let there be with you abundant peace.
God preserve and protect thee May God preserve thee and protect thee,
and cause us to profit by thee. and may He cause us to profit by thee!
